title: VMAC WRITES
content: VMac Writes is hosted on Wordpress.com and has more than 100 blog posts. From Cloud to AI to Gaming.

title: MEDIUM
content: Interesting and important technical thoughts are posted here for your reference. Clap if you like and also check my claps. #AI #ML

title: DZONE
content: DZone Most Valuable Blogger | A collection of my technical articles. Catering Cloud, Cognitive, and many more...

title: Knative Log analysis with LogDNA on IBM Cloud
content: In this post, you will learn how to use the IBM Log Analysis with LogDNA service to configure cluster-level logging for an app named Knative-node-app published in IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service

title: Knative monitoring with Grafana, Zipkin, Weavescope & other plugins..
content: In this post, you will see the telemetry side of Knative and Istio for a nodejs app named Knative-node-app published on IBM Cloud.

title: Build a container image inside a K8s cluster and push it to IBM Cloud Container Registry
content: Learn how to build a source into a container image from a Dockerfile inside a Kubernetes cluster and push the image to IBM Cloud Container Registry; all of this using Google’s Kaniko tool.

title: Install Knative with Istio and deploy an app on IBM Cloud
content: In this tutorial, learn how easy it is to install Knative with Istio on IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service(IKS), build and push an image to IBM Cloud Container Registry and deploy a nodejs app.

title: Obtain and visualise uniform metrics, logs, traces across microservices using Istio
content: In this blog post, you will learn how to setup Istio on your Kubernetes cluster using Helm or Kubernetes-YAML and you will be using add-ons like Jaeger, Prometheus, Grafana, & Weavescope to collect, query and visualize metrics, logs & traces (in-depth telemetry) for your microservices.

title: Deploy a scalable web app to Kubernetes using Helm
content: This blog post walks you through how to scaffold a web application, run it locally in a container, and then deploy it to a Kubernetes cluster created with IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service using a Helm chart.

title: WHAT’S IN IBM CLOUD FOR DEVELOPERS
content: In this post, you will learn what’s in store for developers and how they can leverage 170+ unique services on IBM Cloud platform.

title: Interact with this Chatbot through voice and audio
content: Check step-by-step instructions showing how easy it is to quickly create a voice-enabled Android-native chatbot with Watson Assistant, Text to Speech, Speech to Text and mobile analytics services on IBM Cloud.

title: Build,deploy, and retrain a machine learning model using iris dataset
content: This post walks you through the process of building a predictive machine learning model, deploying it as an API to be used in applications, testing the model and retraining the model with feedback data.

title: Anomaly Detection in mobile sensor data using Machine Learning
content: The post walks you through setting up an IoT device, gathering mobile sensor data in the Watson IoT Platform, exploring data and creating visualizations and then using advanced machine learning services to analyze data and detect anomalies in the historical data.

title: Infrastructure as code with Terraform on Windows
content: This blog post is a quick guide on how to setup Terraform and IBM Cloud Provider on Windows operating system.

title: For Performant Serverless Swift actions…
content: This tutorial goes through the steps of setting up the server side of an iOS mobile app with Swift, including the code and commands for the project.

title: Personifying Chatbots: A Guide to Realistic Conversation
content: If you want your chatbot to pass the Turing Test, it needs to be personified and personalized. Luckily, that's not *too* difficult to do!

title: My High Sierra Story...
content: Disclaimer: This post is just to help macOS users who are facing installation failures or stuck while installing/upgrading to High Sierra.

title: Love Kubernetes?? Now, manage your containers with it on IBM Cloud Container Service
content: This post helps you in getting started with Kubernetes on IBM Cloud via CLI. After a post on how to get started with Docker Containers on IBM Cloud, the next destination was to play with container orchestration on IBM Cloud.

title: A Voice-enabled ChatBot powered by IBM Watson in Mins
content: WatBot is a Voice-enabled Android Native ChatBot built using Watson Conversation, Speech-to-Text and Text-to-Speech Services on IBM Cloud (open standards cloud platform for building, running, and managing apps and services).

title: Speaker Recognition With Watson Speech-to-Text API
content: Learn how to take advantage of IBM Watson’s speaker diarization feature, which distinguishes between speakers in real time.

title: A hybrid Cordova mobile app with Push and Analytics in minutes
content: Following the solution tutorial, you will learn how easy it is to quickly create a Hybrid Cordova application with high-value mobile services like push notifications and mobile analytics on IBM Cloud.
